reviewText: My two girls and husband enjoyed watching the episodes of 7th Heaven which is the best family show of all time. I love that it teaches about morals and at the same time ery entertaining. Great cast!!
If you luv this show, then this is a great purchase to almost finish up the series with.  Nicely done and enjoyable.  Timing in release is good and quite worth the monies.

My son has Down's Syndrome and he migrates from one subject to another in videos but only after COMPLETELY saturating his mind with ALL content of the video. This is why I appreciate videos like 7th Heaven that is a clean show. He is now on his 2nd season of 7th Heaven (and I'm sure will continue to others until he has them all). Prior to these, it was wrestling - P U L E E S E!!!!

It's such a change to switch to 7th Heaven.

I just finished watching my DVDs of Season 10. It was so good (and addictive), that I finished it within 2 weeks. I was really impressed with the handling of the story about Martin and Sandy, and also Ruthie's reaction. Admittedly, I didn't really like Ruthie Camden's character in the earlier seasons, but she came to be one of the more interesting Camden kids. I especially enjoyed her character in Season 10, in the episodes related to her and Martin. I just really liked how this season developed the various personal dramas, and has continued to stick to its philosophy about the virtues and serious commitment of marriage and having a family. I only have one season left to watch, but I have to say - I have really loved this show.

I don't know why I continue to watch this series. The acting is just abysmal. Kevin delivers lines as poorly as those talentless twin boys. Ruthie was a better actress at 5 than she is now at 15. Annie is the ultimate hypocrite. She is judgmental, rude, and obnoxious. They continue to demonize the only decent actor to ever grace this series, Jessica Biel, by making her character abandon her husband and child. They turned Simon into a completely pathetic loser that decides to marry a woman identical to his mother: controlling, rude, and obnoxious. Don't even get me started on Stephen Collins.... When this show aired originally, I had LONG given up before season 10. Now I'm watching it a decade later to see exactly why. At least now I can skip over the really boring, preachy, liberal agenda portions.

There of course is a lot of drama with 7th Heaven..........but a lot of time there is points to ponder.  Some earlier seasons tried too hard to be a comedy.  As I said before, if you can get past Collins history, I think most people would enjoy this series.  I will say, I doubt most parents could put up in real life what this family goes through.  It overall has a religious feel.

I am thoroughly enjoying this series.  I raised three daughters and this brings back many memories, some good and some not so good.  I am a recent convert from Catholicism to Baptist Christian and a lot of what I see in this show helped me to make the transition easier.  I highly recommend this series.

My husband and I both enjoy watching 7th Heaven.  I stumbled upon a newer episode on the Woman's station on a Sunday afternoon and decided to start at the beginning.  With my Amazon Prime membership we have free access through ROKU.  We have been enjoying the entire series ever since.  We have watched as many as 4 episodes in one day.  Most episodes have good messages.  Occasionally there is a message that is the complete opposite from our views but all in all the messages are good.  Lots of laughs and some tears too.  We are now in season 20.  One more season left for us to watch.

Taking Responsibility for one's actions, demonstrating caring even when there's nothing in it for self, why and when to do the right thing without being preachy, shows wise adults leading, life lessons taught in fun yet true to life way, awesome actors, our whole family enjoys.

Not only does it have good lessons on real life situations, it stresses the value of family and the value of every human life. I always thought though that Mary had such a good upbringing and a good responsible personality in the early years that given her good family foundation, she would not have turned out to be as irresponsible as the script portrays her. It just doesn't follow. I realize that she wanted to leave the show and to make up for her absence, showing her to be so irresponsible and having a 180 degree turn on the value of family was one option. It just doesn't make logical sense. I really liked her character and I don't think this scenario does her character justice. It would have been much better to have her die in an accident or from some illness.

I also wish they'd put special features in their dvds too. :)

We almost missed this blessing when we heard from a friend that is was too "worldly" and the kids had too many problems. I am so glad that we decided to see for ourselves. As Christian parents of a 12 year old girl, we are very particular about what we let her watch and what and how she is exposed to certain issues. Yes, the Camden kids have "issues", but what we think is more important is the way in which they solve problems and approach these issues. No one has the "perfect" parenting solutions (well, except our Heavenly Father), but truth, family, honesty and unconditional love seem a good place to start! We think it is important to teach our 12 year old about what is out there. We want her to hear it and talk about it with US first! Thank you to the writers and producers of 7th Heaven for putting "it" out there in a way that was not offensive. We still have Season 10 and the Final to go - but we are "hooked"! (And so are my 78 year old parents!)
By the way - we would probably be labeled "strict" by many - even by  Christian standards!

Grateful Parents in SC

I have always been a fan of 7th heaven since I was a young child. I started watching around season 6 and finished at season 10 when I was younger. I am now 20 and I have finished the entire series. My only complaint about season 10 is that Simon doesn't end up with Rose. For some reason between season 10-11 the screen writers seem to enjoy trashing Martin Brewer, and Simon Camden. I am not sure why but for some reason  both characters end up with the crap end of the bargain. Other than that season 10 probably is the most entertaining season of above all the others. That is if you enjoy relationship drama like me.
